descript.abstract: This GIS data set includes the nearshore and offshore bathymetry of the northern west coast of Florida as lines representing bathymetric contours and polygons representing the depth ranges between the contours. While only the polygon data are served on the ArcIMS site, line contours are also available by request. Please see the Distribution Information section below for data request procedures. Geonex digitized the contours during 1991-1992 from clean, wrinkle-free paper National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) nautical charts. Geonex used the most current versions of the charts available at that time. The source charts used to create this data set varied in scale from 1:10000 to 1:80000, but in all cases, the largest scale charts available were used. Geonex staff members also interpolated additional contours not present on the charts. Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI) staff members digitized the offshore contours from a clean, wrinkle-free paper copy of NOAA Nautical Chart 11006 at a scale of 1:875,000.
descript.purpose: This data set was created to represent marine depth contours and depth range polygons, primarily for cartographic purposes.
descript.supplinf: Prior to July 1, 2004, the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI) was known as the Florida Marine Research Institute (FMRI). The institute name has not been changed in historical data sets or references to work completed by the Florida Marine Research Institute. The institute name has been changed in references to ongoing research, new research, and contact information. These data may contain attribute and positional inaccuracies. Use with caution. These data are not to be used for navigation. User should be aware that later versions of the source charts may be available and that contours may have changed. Consult the appropriate coast pilot and the most recent paper or digital charts available. (previous geoform was 'vector digital data')

idinfo.accconst: All data must be verified by Principal Investigator or Group Database Analyst prior to release. It is strongly recommended that this data is directly acquired from FWC and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. FWC makes no claims as to the data's suitability for other purposes.
idinfo.useconst: FWC-FWRI and the originator of the data must be credited. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation. Acknowledgement of the FWC-FWRI (Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission-Fish and Wildlife Research Institute) as the data source would be appreciated in any products developed from these data, and such acknowledgment as is standard for citation and legal practices for data source is expected by users of this data. Please cite the original metadata when using portions of the record to create a similar record of slightly altered data, such as reprojection. If any data are modified or adjusted, please share the edited information with FWC. Users should be aware that comparison with other data sets for the same area from other time periods may be inaccurate due to inconsistencies resulting from changes in mapping conventions, data collection, and computer processes over time. FWC shall not be liable for improper or incorrect use of this data. These data are not legal documents and are not to be used as such. This is not a survey data set and should not be utilized as such. These data are not to be used for navigation.

idinfo.native: Windows NT Version 4.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 1; ESRI ArcInfo 8.1.0.415

attracc.attraccr: All entities and attributes have been identified and documented. FWRI has not verified attribute accuracy. FWRI has completed a partial quality assurance and quality control check for logical consistency between DEPTH and D-coding attributes.

dataqual.logic: Most of the data are logically consistent. However, some lines are coded as 666, indicating that they are inland water bodies. This attribute should be for polygons only, because a line around an inland water body should have a depth of 0. However, not all of the arcs coded as DEPTH = 666 are indeed shoreline, and not all of the polygons coded as 666 are fully land-locked. This data set needs additional quality checks and editing.
dataqual.complete: Most of the data are logically consistent. However, some lines are coded as 666, indicating that they are inland water bodies. This attribute should be for polygons only, because a line around an inland water body should have a depth of 0. However, not all of the arcs coded as DEPTH = 666 are indeed shoreline, and not all of the polygons coded as 666 are fully land-locked. This data set needs additional quality checks and editing.

horizpa.horizpar: Positional accuracy has not been verified by FWRI. Not all contours match the source charts. Some contours may have been interpolated from other sources. FWRI has not verified that all contours deviating from the source charts are interpolations.

citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Ocean Service
citeinfo.title: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, Nautical Chart 11006

srcinfo.srccontr: The source chart (11006) provided depth contours, measured in fathoms, for the offshore areas.

citeinfo.origin: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, National Ocean Service
citeinfo.title: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration Nautical Charts - various

srcinfo.srccontr: Geonex digitized the nearshore contours from the largest scale charts available.

procstep.procdesc: Geonex digitized the nearshore contours from clean, wrinkle-free paper National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) nautical charts. Geonex used the most current versions of the charts available at that time. The source charts used to create this data set varied in scale from 1:10,000 to 1:80,000, but in all cases, the largest scale charts available were used. In some areas, Geonex staff members interpolated additional contours not present on the charts.

cntinfo.cntinst: Avineon was formerly called Agra Baymont, which was previously GEONEX.

procstep.procdesc: Fish and Wildlife Research Institute (FWRI) staff members digitized the offshore contours from a clean, wrinkle-free paper copy of NOAA Nautical Chart 11006 at a scale of 1:875,000.

This field indicates the depth (in feet) of the shallowest contour represented by the line. In cases where a non-depth item is represented, a special 3-digit number is used to describe the feature. The following values can be found in this data set: 0 = shoreline 3 = 3 feet 6 = 6 feet 12 = 12 feet 18 = 18 feet 30 = 30 feet 60 = 60 feet 120 = 120 feet 180 = 180 feet 240 = 240 feet 300 = 300 feet 600 = 600 feet 1200 = 1200 feet 1800 = 1800 feet 2400 = 2400 feet 3000 = 3000 feet 6000 = 6000 feet 9000 = 9000 feet 333 = oyster bed 444 = undetermined water depth for tidal riverine areas 555 = exposed at mean lower low water 666 = these arcs are improperly coded as inland water body shoreline 777 = dredged channel 888 = spoil 889 = frequently changing 999 = chart border

In cases where a non-depth item is represented, a special 3-digit number is used to describe the feature. enttyp.enttypd: This data set represents bathymetry contours in polygon format.

attr.attrdef: This value represents the depth of the area between two contours. The value of the deeper depth contour is assigned to this item. In cases where a non-depth item is represented, a special 3-digit number is used to describe the feature. The following values can be found in this data set: 0 = Land 3 = 0 to 3 feet 6 = 3 to 6 feet 12 = 6 to 12 feet 18 = 12 to 18 feet 30 = 18 to 30 feet 60 = 30 to 60 feet 120 = 60 to 120 feet 180 = 120 to 180 feet 240 = 180 to 240 feet 300 = 240 to 300 feet 600 = 300 to 600 feet 1200 = 600 to 1200 feet 1800 = 1200 to 1800 feet 2400 = 1800 to 2400 feet 3000 = 2400 to 3000 feet 6000 = 3000 to 6000 feet 9000 = 6000 to 9000 feet 9001 = greater than 9000 feet 333 = oyster bed 444 = undetermined water depth for tidal riverine areas 555 = exposed at mean lower low water 666 = inland water 777 = dredged channel 888 = spoil area 889 = frequently changing area

attrdomv.udom: This value represents the depth of the area between two contours. The value of the deeper depth contour is assigned to this item. In cases where a non-depth item is represented, a special 3-digit number is used to describe the feature. The following values can be found in this data set: 0 = Land 3 = 0 to 3 feet 6 = 3 to 6 feet 12 = 6 to 12 feet 18 = 12 to 18 feet 30 = 18 to 30 feet 60 = 30 to 60 feet 120 = 60 to 120 feet 180 = 120 to 180 feet 240 = 180 to 240 feet 300 = 240 to 300 feet 600 = 300 to 600 feet 1200 = 600 to 1200 feet 1800 = 1200 to 1800 feet 2400 = 1800 to 2400 feet 3000 = 2400 to 3000 feet 6000 = 3000 to 6000 feet 9000 = 6000 to 9000 feet 9001 = greater than 9000 feet 333 = oyster bed 444 = undetermined water depth for tidal riverine areas 555 = exposed at mean lower low water 666 = inland water 777 = dredged channel 888 = spoil area 889 = frequently changing area

attr.attrdef: Textual description of 3-digit code in the D-RANGE attribute OYSTER = oyster bed UNKWTR = undetermined water depth for tidal riverine areas MLW = exposed at mean lower low water INLDWTR = inland water CHANNEL = dredged channel SPOIL = spoil area FRQCHGE = frequently changing area

attrdomv.udom: Textual description of 3-digit code in the D-RANGE attribute OYSTER = oyster bed UNKWTR = undetermined water depth for tidal riverine areas MLW = exposed at mean lower low water INLDWTR = inland water CHANNEL = dredged channel SPOIL = spoil area FRQCHGE = frequently changing area

overview.eaover: Each line contour contains the attribute DEPTH, which represents the shallowest contour depth in feet. Special non-depth items are indicated by 3-digit codes. The D-coding attributes represent the presence or absence of each contour value. Each polygon contains the attribute D-RANGE, which represents the deepest depth value within the range.
overview.eadetcit: Each line contour contains the attribute DEPTH, which represents the shallowest contour depth in feet. Special non-depth items are indicated by 3-digit codes. The D-coding attributes represent the presence or absence of each contour value. Each polygon contains the attribute D-RANGE, which represents the deepest depth value within the range.

In no event will the staff of the Fish and Wildlife Research Institute be liable for any damages, including lost profits, lost savings, or other incidental or consequential damages arising from the use of or the inability to use this data set.

stdorder.fees: None. However, persons or organizations requesting information must provide transfer media if FTP is not available and must pay express shipping costs if express shipping is required.
stdorder.ordering: Contact GIS Librarian by e-mail, telephone, or letter explaining which products are needed and providing a brief description of how the products will be used. Also, provide name and address of the person or organization requesting the products.
stdorder.turnarnd: Usually within 10 business days, although, complex requests may take longer

distinfo.custom: These data have caveats. Contact GIS Librarian for details. If these data are maintained by an agency other than FWC-FWRI, then the source agency should be contacted directly for requests.
